result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon Maurice Galmore

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore in court, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder in court for Trevon Maurice Galmore.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Statement made for sentencing hearing by Jeannie B. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore not in court, in custody.  Attorney John M Binder appeared by video for Trevon Maurice Galmore.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of resolution. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney John M Binder in court, defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney John M Binder in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN. 

Attorney John M Binder in court, defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs discovery to be resent. Defense requests more time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order, Signed and filed.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that Mr. Galmore be allowed to access and view any and all electronic discovery materials in this matter which have been provided to him by his attorney.

Attorney John M Binder in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore in court with Attorney John Binder; both appear by video.  Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 029840,
Payable Number: 995696,
Receipt Number: 22RP012595,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms, or facsimile firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Marco X L-G, Alfredo G, Jesiray Q
Josue E Melendez (co-defendant)
Juvenile J.B. DOB: 10/25/2005, and Juvenile K.A. DOB: 6/25/2006 (known co-occupants of the Buick)

Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton as a friend of the court until he has been fully retained.  Defendant Trevon Maurice Galmore in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon Maurice Galmore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
